issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.body:
Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

Took me 2½w to access IG timelines (involved AGH VPN set to CAN), found these entries that worked for me: > ``` > www.instagram.com##script ~ div[class*=" "][style^=--][style*="255"]:style(scroll-behavior: unset !important; overflow: scroll !important) > www.instagram.com##script ~ div[class*=" "][style^=--][style*="255"] > ``` > But OP claimed they didn't work, so I said I/him had to get help from bigger experts than me. > > The day after, https://github.com/DandelionSprout/adfilt/issues/1011, whose report was better written, reported my `:style` entry caused problems when logged **in**, so now I'm hoping you guys can come up with working entries/research. Username: `@DandelionSprout` ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/gpq4hz7hvdsg8kwgwkckcsko8oooo44o0oh1h1kwas.png?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- Platform: | uBlock Origin System version: | ??????????? comment.body:
Note that for DNS blocking you have some options:
- add a rule `@@||google-analytics.com^|` to the DNS user rules
- use our non-filtered DNS
- use our private DNS and unblock `google-analytics.com` there.

As you might have realized, the app requires analytics for its functioning. This is a bad practice for developers, so you can also contact them to improve this.

@DandelionSprout Could you please take a look at the first issue - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/173600#issue-2153709500
It seems that it's caused by this rule:
```adblock
$document,removeparam=/^ds_/,domain=~clickserve.dartsearch.net
```
from `Legitimate URL Shortener`.
It removes `ds_dest_url` parameter from `ad.doubleclick.net/searchads/link/click?ds_dest_url=` (example link - `https://ad.doubleclick.net/searchads/link/click?ds_dest_url=https://example.org`) and it causes that redirection to destination page doesn't occur.

To reproduce it, please click on `Idź do okazji` button (marked on the screenshot below).
<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29142494/b900bab2-fd76-43cd-a6d7-040d14bda1a5)

</details>

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: Oqee TV for Android TV

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

Adguard AndroidTV 4.3.1

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.oqee.androidmobile&hl=fr&gl=US

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

I use the OqeeTV app on AndroidTV and I want to use Adguard to block ads on it. However, OqeeTV manages to detect Adguard using Google's API.

Through a browser, using the following filter: "||imasdk.googleapis.com/js/sdkloader/ima3.js$script,redirect=google-ima3,domain=oqee.tv," we managed to block ads on Oqee.tv without Adguard being detected.

So, I tried to apply the same filter for AndroidTV: "||imasdk.googleapis.com/js/sdkloader/ima3.js$script,redirect=google-ima3,app=net.oqee.androidtv.store," but it didn't work. The Oqee TV app on AndroidTV still detects Adguard and blocks the videos.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Не повторяется с нашими фильтрами.
Попробуйте оставить только фильтры AdGuard, очистить данные браузера, обновить фильтры (подождите около одной минуты), затем откройте сайт.
Если это не поможет, вам следует повторно включить блокировщики контента (веб расширения) в настройках Safari (подождите примерно столько же времени, сколько и при обновлении фильтров).
